name: The Professional Henchman - Rogue 29 / Fighter 10 / Ranger 1
author: Maximillian Kane

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, Mighty ECBers!

Yesterday I ran into an old friend from WoG whom I hadn’t seen in a very long time. He was walking around with a new toon, which was part of a party. In his character concept, the guy was a “professional” adventurer, a skillful rogue for hire. His build was kind of weird, and we talked about ways to optimize it, but as usual, he wouldn’t listen hehe. To some people, the RP aspect is way too important to powerbuild, but the concept stuck with me, and I thought: “I should build an optimized version for myself”. I loved the concept, a do-it-all kind of Rogue to tag along as a sword for hire, set and disarm traps, open locks, find secret doors (maxed Search). Kind of like what Tomi Undergallows would do for you in the OC.

The only two things that he can’t do are Heal his employer, but give him some Mass Heal scrolls and he can use them, and tank, but give him a Large Shield, Improved Invisibility, and with his High DEX and Epic Dodge from level 27 on, he won’t die easily either! However, it’s as a flanker that this dual-wielding Halfling excels. He has 43 AB (41 Dual-wielding), and 15d6 of Sneak Attack damage to tear the flankees apart! He possesses HUGE Hide and Move Silently scores and even an Epic Skill Focus in spot to detect other hidden enemies with ease (unless they’re like him LOL). The coolest touch IMO, he has 16 INT for a total of over 400 skill points. He can set epic traps, recover all traps, stealth through virtually any non-true-seeing enemy, and he can craft his own traps to be even deadlier. While everyone else is asleep, this mercenary will be preparing his tools for the upcoming adventure.

There are no similar builds in the Search Engine. Most of the builds with this class combo go heavy on Ranger for Bane of Enemies, and the only one who doesn’t, takes 15 levels of it. There are many with Shadowdancer instead of Ranger, but I can’t picture a sword for hire that HiPSes away and leaves you to die. He wouldn’t work much if that were the case.

Anyway, without further delay, I proudly present you: The Professional Henchman!
